title: Allow a subset of `<geometry>` instead of `<inertia>`

content.raw:
# Issue

The `<inertial>` element requires an inertial matrix `<inertia>`. When creating models I often find myself plugging the geometry of the `<collision>` into one of the formulas on [this wikipedia page](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_moments_of_inertia), which can be prone to errors as I often end up changing the geometry.

# Proposal

The proposal is to allow a subset of the shapes in `<geometry>` (box, cylinder, sphere) as an alternative to `<inertia>`. The inertia matrix values would be calculated by assuming uniform density.

```xml
<link name="some_link">
  <collision name="my_collision">
    <geometry>
      <sphere>
        <radius>0.5</radius>
      </sphere>
    </geometry>
  </collision>
  <inertial>
    <mass>1.0</mass>
    <sphere>
      <radius>0.5</radius>
    </sphere>
  </inertial>
</link>
```

# Related

Issue #95 combined with this feature would make it much easier to specify the inertia on a link with multiple `<collision>`.
